trait.name: Languages
trait.text: Vishkanyas begin play speaking Common and Vishkanya. Vishkanyas with high Intelligence scores can choose from the following: Aklo, Draconic, Elven, Goblin, Sylvan, and Undercommon.

trait.name: Poison Resistance
trait.text: A vishkanya has a racial bonus on saving throws against poison equal to its Hit Dice.

trait.name: Keen Senses
trait.text: Vishkanyas receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks.

trait.name: Limber
trait.text: Vishkanyas receive a +2 racial bonus on Escape Artist and Stealth checks.

trait.name: Low-Light Vision
trait.text: Vishkanyas can see twice as far as humans in conditions of dim light.

trait.name: Poison Use
trait.text: Vishkanyas are skilled in the use of poison and never accidentally poison themselves when using or applying poison.

trait.name: Toxic
trait.text: A number of times per day equal to his Constitution modifier (minimum 1/day), a vishkanya can envenom a weapon that he wields with his toxic saliva or blood (using blood requires the vishkanya to be injured when he uses this ability). Applying venom in this way is a swift action. Vishkanya Venom: Injury; save Fort DC 10 + 1/2 the vishkanya’s Hit Dice + the vishkanya’s Constitution modifier; frequency 1/round for 6 rounds; effect 1d2 Dex; cure 1 save.

trait.name: Weapon Familiarity
trait.text: Vishkanyas are always proficient with blowguns, kukri, and shuriken.

trait.name: Deceptive (Alternate Racial Traits)
trait.text: Vishkanya clans that make their livings robbing or killing humans train to distract targets at critical moments. They gain a +2 racial bonus on Bluff checks. This racial trait replaces Limber.

trait.name: Sensual (Alternate Racial Traits)
trait.text: You are trained in drawing attention to yourself. You gain a +2 bonus on any one Perform skill. This racial trait replaces keen senses.

trait.name: Subtle Appearance (Alternate Racial Traits)
trait.text: You have normal (human-like) eyes, and your beauty is more conventional. You gain a +4 bonus on Disguise checks to look fully human. This racial trait replaces low-light vision.
